LinkedIn Job Search Overview
edit

What is LinkedIn Job Search?

LinkedIn Job Search is a tool that allow user to quickly find job opportunities with location-based search and get automatic recommendations and notifications based on job searches.

Feb 07, 2018

"Crappy Service"

Describe the project or task LinkedIn Job Search helped with:

Used for job postings and to search for the best candidates out there. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What do you like best about LinkedIn Job Search?

Nothing at all. It is the most useless service I have come across. If Microsoft thinks that LinkedIn Job Search is in any way "Machine Learning", then they are grossly mistaken. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What do you dislike about LinkedIn Job Search?

Job searches don't appear based on a person's current job or industry. The job searches show up based on keywords. So, someone that is an Executive Assistant would actually get a job posting for an Executive Vice President. If someone is a VP at a company called AutoGrid (which has nothing to do with Automobiles), he or she would get job recommendations for an auto industry job. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

Recommendations to others considering LinkedIn Job Search:

DO not use this service. It sucks. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

Incentivized Review
Nov 01, 2017

"LinkedIn Job Search Paid Version"

Describe the project or task LinkedIn Job Search helped with:

LinkedIn Job Search helped me explore job opportunities at millions of companies. I could search for a job and save it to apply to latter and know what jobs I had applied for. Being on LinkedIn allowed me to know if I had connections that worked at these companies and allowed me to reach out to them and ask question about the company. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What do you like best about LinkedIn Job Search?

The best part was knowing where you fit in, according to LinkedIn, in the ranking of candidates. I also liked the fact that there was some indication of expectant salary for positions, keeping track of jobs I had applied for and saving some to apply for.

Being an avid user of LinkedIn with many connections also allowed me to see who was working at companies where I was thinking of applying. I could reach out to them and ask questions prior to applying or if chosen for an interview.

The Learning center is great inside of LinkedIn as well. It gives you the option to take courses and have them appear on your LinkedIn Profile. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What do you dislike about LinkedIn Job Search?

I didn't like that you didn't have a lot of options to sort for jobs by location. I couldn't search for jobs in different cities. If I chose a state or province I would miss posts to various cities in those provinces. LinkedIn has a problem with reporting who has viewed your profile and they are aware of this but it has never been fixed it. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

Recommendations to others considering LinkedIn Job Search:

Save as many jobs to apply for as you like. Take advantage of the learning center. Visit profiles of the people who have posted the job listing. Make use of this search being on LinkedIn and learn about the company before any job interviews. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

Jan 01, 2018

"LinkedIn Job Search"

Describe the project or task LinkedIn Job Search helped with:

Overall, LinkedIn is great to way for employers to find people through common connections and a great way to network. As far as trying to find a job, it is like a needle in a haystack because often times it doesn't give you the proper jobs. Often times it seems to give you quantity instead of quality. And it also give you the same job repeatedly. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What do you like best about LinkedIn Job Search?

I like how you can look for a job within a certain area and see the estimated salary for that job. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What do you dislike about LinkedIn Job Search?

The jobs are not rated to how they would most likely fit the ideal job you are hoping to find. Also, when you search for a job, it continues to give you the same jobs you've seen before and a lot of the job are not relevant to what you are hoping to find. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
